Job Description

eLeapPower

eLeapPower is an award-winning growth company which produces game-changing technologies for e-mobility and electric vehicles (EVs). eLeapPower’s technologies enable EVs to charge faster, drive greener, and reduce costs. It also allows EVs to also charge with renewable energy, making EVs truly green.

Our suite of solutions for charging and high voltage EV powertrain applications are disruptive, proven and being deployed. We are at the cutting edge of the sector and have a contract with one of the world’s leading automobile manufacturers putting us well on our way towards our goal of accelerating the adoption of EVs globally and driving a low-carbon economy. Join us on this exciting journey as we get our technologies on the road!

We are always looking for talented people. Our team is comprised of the best and brightest minds, wide ranging expertise, and the ambition to solve the world- changing problems. If you have a passion for innovation and developing technology solutions, we want to hear from you. We employ team members in a variety of roles including Electrical Engineers, Embedded Software Engineers, Product Managers and System Engineers.

Here are some of the typical roles we’re always open to candidates for:

The Electrical Engineer delivers designs for high power, automotive inverters (100kW+, 400V/800V) based on technical requirements and relevant automotive standards, develops test plan, conduct testing and troubleshooting of designed parts and models and simulates power electronics using tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, SPICE, and PLECS. You have a degree or advanced degree in Electronics or Electrical Engineering plus industry experience in power electronics design, automotive inverter, or automotive charger design.

The Embedded Software Engineer designs, develops, tests, and debugs embedded software to control electric vehicle traction inverters and charging systems, works with microcontrollers (MCUs) and field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs) and supports the integration of our system into customer vehicles. You possess a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical/Electronic Engineering or a related field and experience designing embedded software in C along with automotive/industrial engineering experience with the entire software development process, including design, implementation, testing, and debugging.

The Product Engineer or Product Manager will help bridge the gap between the customer and the engineering team. This can be achieved by analyzing market and industry trends, summarizing technology development and technical topics and by developing external material for different audiences. The product engineer supports the research, planning and execution of product strategy, product development and is the spokesperson for customer interactions. You have a degree in Electrical Engineering coupled with product development lifecycle knowledge and experience in sales, product planning, product R&D and/or pre-sales technical support related to electrical vehicle inverter or charging products.

We offer meaningful work that makes a difference in the world. Get in touch if you are interested in being considered for opportunities now or in the future.

eLeapPower is committed to diversity, personal growth, social and environmental responsibility and ensuring that we create a fun place to work. Our office and labs are conveniently located in North York (DVP/Lawrence).
